Recipe.Description: Busted up potatoes roasted with red wine and corriander.

Prerequisites.Prerequisite: Preheat ovens and large backing sheet to 425Â°F.
Put coriander in small pan over medium heat, shaking until coriander is lightly toasted and begins to release a pleasant aroma, set aside to cool.
Using a suitably heavy tool (hammer, small 2X4), whack the potatoes in such a way so they become cracked, but otherwise stay whole and retain their shape.

Method.Step: Put potatoes in a large bowl. Toss with oil and coriander, season with salt and pepper.
Transfer to baking sheet in oven. Bake until potatoes are tender, maybe 30 minutes. Meanwhile...
Bring wine to a boil in a sauce pan and reduce slightly, maybe 5-10 minutes.
When potatoes are done, transfer to a large serving bowl, toss with wine.
Garnish with parsley sprigs and chive sticks. Serve immediately.
